programme.desc: The Doctor and Amy arrive in one of the most important eras of Britain's past - World War Two. In a secret room beneath London, the infamous alien villains, the Daleks, are dreaming up a deadly plot.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Trouble arrives when River Song returns to the Doctor's life. The last of the Weeping Angels is loose and the Doctor must track it down. Amy is warned not to blink but it may not be the right advice.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Trouble arrives when River Song returns to the Doctor's life. The last of the Weeping Angels is loose and the Doctor must track it down. Amy is warned not to blink but it may not be the right advice.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor takes Amy and Rory away for a romantic break but terror awaits in 16th century Venice. The House of Calvierri protects the city of Venice, but when blood-drained corpses start to show up in the streets, the Doctor suspects the Calvierri.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: After being going for five years, the Doctor reappears in Amy's life and she is faced with having to make a terrible choice.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: It's 2015 and scientists are drilling far into the Earth's crust, hoping to make history, but deep below the surface, something is not right.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor battles to prevent an all out war between the Silurians and the humans. As a potential apocalypse looms, the Doctor discovers an even more horrifying danger waits for him.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Amy finds herself battling a deadly alien in France with none other than Vincent Van Gogh.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: When people begin disappearing in a flat, the Doctor investigates a mysterious staircase in the building that you can walk up, but never down.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor receives a message from his allies that the Pandorica, which allegedly holds the most fearsome being in the universe, is about to open.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Rory maintains a vigil for Amy while the Doctor is trapped in the Pandorica. The key to restoring the universe may lie with a little girl who still believes in stars.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor, Amy and Rory receive a secret summons that leads them to the Oval Office in 1969. Enlisting the help of a former FBI agent and the irrepressible River Song, the Doctor promises to assist the President.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor is locked in the perfect prison. Amy, Rory and River Song are being hunted down by the FBI. With the help of President Nixon and Neil Armstrong, the Doctor is able to mount a rebellion against an alien invasion.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The TARDIS is marooned onboard a 17th-century pirate ship whose crew is being attacked by a mysterious and beautiful sea creature. Becalmed and beset by cabin fever, the pirates have numerous superstitious explanations for the Siren's appearance.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: By following a Time Lord distress signal, the Doctor puts Amy, Rory and his beloved TARDIS in grave danger.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: A solar tsunami liberates doppelgangers from their human 'originals' in a futuristic factory.

programme.title: Doctor Who

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor assembles an army to face the Battle of Demons Run. River Song has something to tell him.

programme.title: Doctor Who

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: Hunter the koala is ready for a mate. Jaws the Galápagos tortoise isn't feeling well and the zoo staff works to bring him out of his shell. The Safari Park has not one but two baby giraffe calves that need to be hand-reared simultaneously.

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: The Zoo says goodbye to beloved pandas Bai-Yun and Xiao Liwu as mother and cub prepare to return to China. Tembo the retired 'Hollywood' elephant tries traditional Chinese medicine for her arthritis. The Butterfly Jungle gets colored for the season.

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: After six years away, Mek the tiger returns to the Zoo. Two shy tree kangaroos, Spike and Polly, meet for the first time. And, with the Children's Zoo under construction, the keepers have to move over 100 animals, including a herd of reluctant goats.

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: Safari Park keepers say goodbye to two elephant brothers. We find out if the San Diego Zoo vets can design a custom shoe for Felix, an excitable three-toed baird's tapir. Then, two African Penguin chicks grow up and get ready to join the colony.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Trust and experience are put to the test when an elephant requires delicate veterinary treatment from her keepers. Endangered pink pigeons need all the help they can get to produce offspring. Monty the adorable otter needs to visit the dentist.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The squirrel monkeys play hard-to-get with the Children's Zoo's keepers, a pair of Komodo dragons meet for the first time with explosive results and the Inca terns prepare for their first big flight.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: An okapi called Magani is ready to breed and is paired with veteran Kweli to learn the ropes. Lola the blue iguana plays hard-to-get when introduced to a potential mate, and anteater Velcro shows off her talents with a new tool.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A charismatic ostrich named Olga works to be reunited with her flock. Buster the squirrel monkey is introduced to the zoo's troop of feisty females. A functionally extinct species of turtle finds new life, and everyone's favorite warthog is back.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The zoo anxiously awaits the arrival of a snow leopard called K2's fourth cub. The staff is pleased when a pair of Andean condors embrace their new enclosure, while a squirmy binturong fights his annual vaccination.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Two sickly newborn fawns form an unbreakable bond while they are hand-reared by staff. Leopard Khazo gets a surprise that enhances her life, and tensions run high as the reptile staff attempts to collect blood from Cuban crocs.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A rowdy, young markhor is injured and vets must treat his infected hoof. The TAB staff head to Manhattan to rescue a wallaby living in an apartment, while a fruit bat discovers how to spread her wings, and a trio of alligators move into their summer home.

programme.title: The Zoo

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: After failed Black Friday shopping, Marge is determined to fix Christmas but Homer and the kids decide to surprise her by going on vacation to a Floridian resort that turns out to be a knock-off Disney World.

programme.title: Prancer Returns

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: A young boy is accidentally left at home when his family goes away for Christmas vacation. He must fend for himself as he faces burglars, scary neighbours and other obstacles. At first he enjoys his freedom, but soon wants his family back for Christmas.

programme.title: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
programme.desc: A young boy mistakenly takes the wrong plane when his family goes on Christmas vacation and ends up in New York City, fending off suspicious hotel staff, a kindly bird woman in disguise and two burglars he fought against last Christmas.

programme.title: How the Grinch Stole Christmas
programme.desc: A nasty creature plans to steal Christmas from the residents of Whoville, who love Christmas, until a small child named Cindy Lou Who decides to befriend him. A fun-filled remake of the classic cartoon and Dr. Seuss favourite.

programme.title: Frosty the Snowman
programme.desc: A discarded silk top hat becomes the focus of a struggle between a washed-up stage magician and a group of schoolchildren after it brings a snowman to life. Pursued by the greedy magician and rising temperatures, Frosty sets off for the North Pole.

programme.title: Rudolph, the Red-Nosed Reindeer
programme.desc: Recount the tale of a shy reindeer whose Christmas spirit is dampened because his shiny red nose has made him the laughing stock of all Christmasville. Based on the popular song by Johnny Marks and narrated by Burl Ives.

programme.title: Santa Claus Is Comin' to Town
programme.desc: Kris Kringle overcomes the evil Burgermeister Meisterburger who has banned toys from the land of Sombertown. With the help of Mother Nature, magical elves and special reindeer, he is able to deliver toys to children all over the world.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: When a private company buys the school, Lisa discovers that it's a top toy company conducting research to design their hot new Christmas toy. Lisa and Bart go to investigate the company but are stymied by its security guard, Gary Coleman.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moe returns to bartending school to hone his skills and leaves Homer in charge of the bar.

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Herschel Walker's career in the SEC was legendary, but his journey off the field was filled with struggle, pain, and ultimately, redemption.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Written into the pages of football folklore is the Manning legend, a story started by patriarch, Archie, with chapters featuring his sons, Cooper, Peyton and Eli. Director Rory Karpf explores how a tragedy shaped the course of their lives.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: This profile of Steve Spurrier looks at his close ties to the SEC as a young fan, a Heisman Trophy winning quarterback and an accomplished coach.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Condredge Holloway became the first African American quarterback in the SEC.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Jerry Jones and Jimmy Johnson teamed up to help lead the 1964 Arkansas Razorbacks football squad to its only undefeated season in history, long before they joined forces to win two Super Bowls with the NFL Dallas Cowboys.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: When Michael Sam announced on February 9, 2014 that he was gay, he became football's first openly gay active player. For most, the revelation was a surprise. For his teammates, it was not news. Michael had found acceptance in the Tigers football family.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Florida's big five return for the 2007 season to become the first school to repeat as basketball national champions with the same starting lineup.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: George Washington Rogers, winner of the Heisman Trophy in 1980, tells the story of his life.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Derrick Thomas was a legendary college pass rusher and talented linebacker in the NFL before an accident at 33 years old took his life. See how his legacy continues to influence the world years later.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: There is no more hallowed figure in sports journalism than Grantland Rice, who maintained a ruling perch across the sports world for more than 50 years. This film relives sport's golden era through the eyes of a reporter who had a front row seat.

programme.title: Saturdays in the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Civil War, America's south is looking to put the past behind it, and finds one path in a growing cultural passion of the north: football. In December 1932, the Southeastern Conference is officially formed.

programme.title: Saturdays in the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: Multiple SEC schools claim national titles from the 1930s through the 1950s. In 1958, LSU won with star running back Billy Cannon leading the way, and a year later Cannon had epic game-winning punt return against powerhouse Ole Miss.

programme.title: Saturdays in the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Georgia Tech leaves the conference and the civil rights movement becomes embedded in the history and image of the region. Bear Bryant, hired in 1958, becomes the face of Alabama, and of SEC football.

programme.title: Saturdays in the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: As a new decade dawns, quarterbacks Archie Manning, Bert Jones and Condredge Holloway build memorable legacies. Bear Bryant begins a new run of dominance at Alabama, and the rise of television sports transforms the SEC.

programme.title: Saturdays in the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: The 1980s begin with Herschel Walker leading Georgia to a national title as a freshman. After Bear Bryant retires in 1982 and passes away four weeks later, control of the SEC is eventually transferred to Pat Dye and Bo Jackson at Auburn.

programme.title: Saturdays in the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: The 1990s bring change with expansion and the sport's first-ever conference championship game. Florida's Steve Spurrier fashions an era of high-octane offense, and his Gators form a rivalry with Tennessee and quarterback Peyton Manning.

programme.title: Saturdays in the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: Nick Saban comes to LSU in 2000 and eventually wins the Tigers' first national championship since 1958 - a feat matched by Les Miles. At Florida, Tim Tebow becomes a cult hero and wins two national titles with Urban Meyer's Gators.

programme.title: Saturdays in the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: The SEC has a run of seven straight national titles, and nine in 12 years. Expansion in 2012 gives the conference 14 schools. Meanwhile, Nick Saban arguably becomes the greatest coach in the history of college football.

programme.title: Football Classics
programme.desc: November 10, 2012.

programme.title: Football Classics
programme.desc: September 27, 2008.

programme.title: Football Classics
programme.desc: October 12, 2013.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Greek natives and their kin built the Birmingham restaurant scene, from barbecue joints to hotdog stands to steakhouses. Bright Star, founded in 1907, is the old guard and Johnny's is the new guard Greek restaurant. This is what the future looks like.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Pablo Rivadeneyra rotisserie-cooks lime-marinated chicken in Norwood. Across the street at Scott's BBQ, Larry and Betty Jean Scott work a smoke-belching pit. In these two places, we get a glimpse of the hard work that defines life in the south.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: One meat and three vegetables is the formula for a typical farmhand meal, translated in the mid-twentieth century to steam table cafes. In Nashville, the differences between Black and White cooking come into focus, and we discover that there are few.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Shreveport emerged in the mid-1800s as a lumber boomtown on the Red River. Cycles of boom and bust has defined this town. Herby K's is a 1936 vintage beer garden and fry house. Lucky Palace serves wok-fried T-bones and pork egg foo young.

programme.title: TrueSouth

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Once a Southern institution, barbecue has become an American obsession and Texas brisket has been mainstreamed. This is a story about a scrappy onetime oil boomtown, where cooks make the most of scraps, and about two Gulf Coast dishes that have hung on.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: In the southern towns of Hodgenville and Bardstown, Kentucky, the land where Lincoln was born, conflicting ideas about identity and purpose come into focus. Onion burgers and country sausage prove constants in a time of great change.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Lyndzie believes she was royalty in a past life and this WAG intends to have a royal wedding in this life. Bride Ashley wants a dress that's not too revealing so her mom won't have a heart attack.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Courtney is determined to look at every dress in Kleinfeld. Bride Brianna wants a dress inspired by a movie.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: It's all about the bling when Samantha falls for a dress that's twice her budget. Krystina wants simple while her mom wants over the top. Shannon ordered a custom gown for her Irish I do's.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: It's a star studded premiere as Jenna and Val from "Dancing With the Stars" waltz into Kleinfeld to find her dream dress. WWE Hall of Famer Mick Foley steps out of the ring to help his friend Heather find a last minute dress after hers is ruined.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Pnina megafan Julianna wants the sexiest dress ever but her fiancé's family are afraid she'll say yes to a dress she'll regret. Plus, jumpsuit enthusiast Randell wants a wedding onesie - too bad Randy and Lisa can't find any.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bridal model Jessica is depending on her feisty friends to help her make a decision, but when they get out of control Randy has to step in. New mom Marlo is back with her outspoken twin Margo and hopes she can keep her brutally honest comments in check.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: After losing her dress in the California wildfires, Eryka comes to Kleinfeld hoping she can fall in love with a new dress. Shay helps Ashley feel sexy after losing over 100 pounds. Randy helps a desperate bride whose dress has disappeared.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pregnant woman delivers in the front seat of her car and a bride stops her wedding because she feels possessed by creatures crawling in her head. Later, a physician yells at her comatose heart attack patient, trying to get him to fight for his own life.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A deranged cowboy is drenched in sweat, saliva and urine and no one knows why. A metal rod is impaled into the side of a young woman's head. Two teenage girls are dangerously short of breath.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A violent patient who cannot be sedated endangers a pregnant ER doctor. An unexplained headache turns life threatening for a mom during a vacation, while a man with a fencepost through his torso jumps the triage line on a busy night in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A conscious man is wheeled into the ER with a two-inch pipe through his head. A young bride is experiencing unstoppable bleeding and her groom is clueless. Two prisoners from rival gangs are suspiciously in the ER at the same time.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pianist's finger is accidentally sawed off and missing until his wife and dog come to the ER. A man's pacemaker is killing him, yet keeping him alive, and after his bachelor party, a nurse's fiancé is behaving bizarrely.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: When a man believes he is constipated, he visits the ER only to find out his condition is much worse. A young woman experiences cardiac arrest and the doctor finds she's treating two patients in one. Also, a patient's family is entirely clueless.

programme.title: 1000-lb Sisters
programme.desc: The Slaton's are larger-than-life sisters who have always relied on each other and food for support. Amy, age 31, is desperate to have children, but hasn't been able to due to her weight. While Tammy, age 32, is one step away from being bedridden.

programme.title: 1000-lb Sisters
programme.desc: Amy and Tammy go to Atlanta to meet Dr. Procter to discuss weight loss surgery. When they arrive, Dr. Procter gives Tammy a hefty weight loss goal before he will approve her for surgery, meanwhile the Dietician has more bad news for Amy.

programme.title: 1000-lb Sisters
programme.desc: Amy and Tammy eagerly begin their weight loss journey. Sticking to their diets is a matter of life or death but proves to be a real struggle. The pressure to reach their goals culminates in a huge fight that threatens their diets and relationship.

programme.title: 1000-lb Sisters
programme.desc: After a stressful first month of dieting, the sisters head back to Atlanta for their one-month check in with Dr. Procter to find out if they are on the right path to their weight goals. The results force Amy to make a difficult decision.

programme.title: 1000-lb Sisters
programme.desc: Amy decides to have a real wedding ceremony because if she gets approved for surgery, she's afraid she may not survive. After the wedding, the sisters head to Atlanta hoping for a life-changing final weigh-in.

programme.title: 1000-lb Sisters
programme.desc: Amy undergoes gastric bypass surgery to change her life, but endangers herself by not sticking to the post-op diet. Tammy seeks support from her love interest, Jerry. Two months later, the sisters reveal the changes they've made to family and friends.
